intro: Gaerdtia stenobotrys, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spiderling, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Gaerdtia stenobotrys is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
